body: It works fine creating a large matrix on GPU. However when I run train_mnist.py it still fails and the python stop working. The GPU is M40. I tried run train_mnist.py on K40, it works fine.

@sxjscience Why did you close this?  I don't see a PR to support EA-SGD.  I understand that there is sample code posted here in this github issue.  But that's extremely difficult to use for most people.  I think it should be supported as a first-class algorithm in MXNet.
attr={'lr_mult': '0'}
@leopd I've closed it because this issue has been inactive for more than 9 months. For now let me reopen it and see if people are interested in supporting EASGD.

> only enables cudnn version when all input requirements are met, since the cudnn version is strictly more limited.

@szha: why was that not enough? Why do you need to completely turn it off?
hi, guy , I searched the 'lr_mult' in the whole mxnet source code. it only appeared in *.py files. so , I don't think this is the answer.

Please don't close valid & useful feature requests just because it's taking them a long time to be implemented.  To quote the OP: "sparse gradient update of word embedding in the NLP is so important !!!!"
Thank you very much! I'm new to mxnet and didn't see the cause right away.
Say, I got lots of samples, but not all samples are the same importance. I wanna to give every sample an importance, i.e. instance weight.
bn = mx.sym.BatchNorm(data=conv, attr={'lr_mult': '0.1'})

Your label may represent attributes, so you can try **logistic loss** on multiple output channels in which each output channel represent prob of an attribute.
So when the prob(i.e. sigmoid) of attribute of channel 'dance' is greater than 0.5, the video has attribute 'dance'. So do the 'sing' attribute channel.

The 'convert_symbol.py' tool in 'tools\caffe_converter' can convert the protobuf of caffe to python code of mxnet and then execute the created code to establish symbol graph and save to json. You can draw inspiration from that.
@leopd I feel that the sparse gradient update feature is added now by @eric-haibin-lin . See https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/7921 for a tutorial.
We don't have a separate issue for general sampling. Feel free to open one, otherwise I will put you on cc on the upcoming pull request
Great!  I'm super glad to hear that.
it is just a learning rate multiplier, it is not what I am looking for.
Which version of MXNet are you using? Is it the master branch?
train.py --num-class 10 --class-names '1,2,3...'
That cpp codebase for ssd detection is deprecated. It's not entirely compatible now. But you can always use the provided model in that repo, it's old but still working.
